alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 6:10AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS RESULTING IN VERY DIFFICULT TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THE SNOWBELT THIS MORNING... Heavy lake-effect snow showers will continue to move into the Lake Superior snowbelt this morning. The snow, combined with blowing and drifting snow generated by northwest winds gusting to 35 mph will result in near blizzard conditions at times, and very difficult travel conditions. The snow showers will begin to diminish this afternoon. Lighter snow showers will continue into tonight. Travel in the snowbelt will be very difficult at times today, especially in open areas. If possible, consider postponing travel until conditions improve. Farther south and east, from Rhineland through Crandon to near Iron Mountain, the snow showers will not be as persistent. But winds will still be strong, so blowing and drifting snow will affect these areas as well. Use caution while traveling in these areas, especially in open terrain.
